name: Riyadh Marriott Hotel

reviews.text: Spent two nights in the Marriott due to a business trip to Riyadh. I was very satisfied with the hotel, and wished I could have spent some more time in the comfortable bed, instead of attending meetings all day (and night) long. To start with, the entrance is well protected against violence. i.e. there is security screening and cars cannot drive directly to the entrance. The staff is very friendly, and even though there are only two persons working at the reception, they undertake endeavours to serve the guests. If you are in a hurry, prepare some time for that. The food is quite good, the snacks in the bar as well. Smoking areas are available. The rooms are well equipped, including ironing board and coffee maker. breakfast served in room is very punctual. Clean. Bathroom amenities good. I had a room with almost no view, a bit dark, and couldn't open the window. Now here are some downsides: Newspaper only delivered one morning, other morning no newspaper. Slippers provided second evening, first evening no slippers. But to conclude - overall a very good hotel.
reviews.title: Fully satisfied with the hotel - relaxing

reviews.text: Good Mariott hotel but not well located. Far from downtown (cab necessary - not walking distance)
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is clean and quiet. It is not really near anything and requires a taxi to get anywhere. The hotel staff was very helpful and courteous.
reviews.title: One of the most basic international hotels I've stayed in

reviews.text: We ate at the Mosaic a few times. The salad buffet was very nice. It was expensive but had a nice assortment of food including non-meat for vegetarians.
reviews.title: A Substandard Experience

reviews.text: I stayed at the Riyadh Marriott from July 15-18, thinking it would be standard Marriott quality- certainly not.
reviews.title: dissapointing

reviews.text: First, the location. There isn't anything close by/within walking distance, except to say the airport is only ~25-30 minutes by car. To get downtown, it's a 15-25 minute taxi, depending on traffic.
reviews.title: Old and depressing

reviews.text: The interior of the hotel seems like it's out of the 70s. It was hard to believe this was a Marriott in a city where a lot of well-paid American businesspeople come. The service was fine, but upon arriving to my room, there was only a narrow window in one corner that never provided sufficient light- it was like staying a closet. The desk chair creaked like it was going to fall over at any moment, and the interior was generally hum-drum.
reviews.title: The best hotel I ever stayed in

likes.liked: — Quality of the hotel and service provided

reviews.text: I ate in two restaurants- one near the lobby that was way over-priced, but decent quality, and I also ate the buffet, which was fine. I worked out in the health club, which is actually quiet nice, but humid due to the pool.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

description: Riyadh Marriott Hotel stands majestically in the center of Riyadh City's corporate, financial and governmental agencies. This luxurious Marriott hotel in Riyadh is just minutes-drive from major shopping malls and downtown districts with easy access to King Khalid International Airport. The hotel offers excellent services in our Makarim Convention Center, Atrium Cafe, Mosaic Mediterranean Restaurant and Terrace Grill Restaurant. After business meetings and Riyadh attractions, relax in our indoor swimming pool and spa at Bodyline Health Club & Spa. You may just want the serenity and comfort in any of the 391 business-friendly rooms and suites with new beds from Marriott, down comforters, designer duvets and fluffier pillows. This multi-awarded, convenient hotel is perfect for business, conferences, events, weekend getaways, family travel and wedding. It has also 20 flexible meeting rooms, state-of-the-art space that includes Grand Ballroom and breakout rooms. Come and experience our unique Arabian hospitality.
